Key: ACHOO!
Sh-Shido? What's the matter? Are you cold?

(While walking home from school, I had an
intense sneeze, prompting Tohka to get up
close to me.)

You know, it's been getting chilly recently,
hasn't it? You okay, Tohka?

Don't worry. I'm just warm and fuzzy from
being with you, Shido!
...Ah, right!

(Tohka puffed her chest out proudly. I had
no idea how to respond.)
Hm? What's the matter, Shido?
Oh, nothing. I was just feeling shy.
R-Really? Sorry...
No, no. It's nothing to apologize for.

(I shook my head and played off the fact
that I was taken aback.)

(Tohka had a gift for startling me. I thought
I'd get used to it by now, but it's still
something I get shy over.)

(Especially when Tohka doted upon me.
Ever since we started dating, she's been
willing to wait on me, hand and knee.)
Shido, what is the matter? Are you ill?

No, I'm fine. Got some stuff on my mind.
It's not a cold or anything.

Are you certain? When temperatures drop, I
hear it is easier to get sick. I do not want you
to get sick.
Yeah. I'll be careful.
Shido, do you have a moment?
Hm? What is it?
..T-Tohka?
Hm. You are not hot.
Y-Yeah... Thanks.

(Tohka's cool hand felt nice on my forehead,
but being in the middle of the street made me
panic. At least it was just her hand...)

Shido, your face is turning red. Perhaps you
are sick.

No, I'm totally fine! It really isn't a cold,
so don't worry about it.
Hm. You are sure? Well, okay... BUT!
But what?

If you feel any symptoms, be sure to tell me,
okay?
Thanks, Tohka. Take care of yourself too, okay?
Right! So long as I have you, I'll be fine!

(There she goes again with that stuff.
I pretended to shrug it off as I continued
walking.)
(But in truth, it warmed my heart a bit.)

It's only going to get colder, though. I need
to start wearing layers.

Come to think of it, you don't have many
winter clothes, do you?

(Tohka's life is supported by Ratatoskr.
I bet they give her new clothes, too.)

Reine gave me some, I believe. However I
have yet to purchase some for myself.

All right! Then, why don't we take a look
at some outfits tomorrow?

(I just realized this is Tohka's first winter.
She's never picked out winter clothes before,
so it could be a new, fun experience for her.)
Okay. It's a date! I can't wait!
Yup. It's a date.

(Saying that still makes me blush, but I should
be used to it. We've gone on plenty of dates
by now.)

Let's meet tomorrow at the shopping district
at 11.
Understood! I am already so excited!

So the plan is for Shido... to pick exactly
whichever outfits he prefers me in, right?!
Hm? Did you say something?
N-Nothing! See you at supper!
Okay, later.

(It was the next day, 11 on the dot. Tohka
had arrived right on time.)
Sh-Shido. I am sorry. Did I keep you waiting?
No, I just got here too. Morning, Tohka.
Okay, morning!
So, um, what do you think? Is my outfit strange?
(Tohka asked me sheepishly.)

(She wore stockings and a mini-skirt. Her
legs were so long and alluring.)

(Bu-But that skirt sure is short. Well, her
outfit wasn't anything out of the ordin―)

(What am I doing...? We're about to go on
a date, and I'm having these thoughts.)

If you were worried about being late, you
could've just come with me.

N-No, I can't! Then it would not be like a
date, right?
Well, not to me...

Ai and the girls had said so. They said, in
order for it to be an official date, we must
meet separately.

Sure, I guess that makes sense. Oh well.
Whatever. Let's go.
Okay! On the hunt for winter clothes!

All right. Let's get going. I hope we can find
you something nice.

(There were plenty of clothing stores, but I'm
not too aware of what they sell. Guess we can
hit stores we're used to.)
Hm. A breeze keeps tingling my legs.
Tohka, what's the matter?
Fue?!
A-About what?
Oh. You just seemed uncomfortable.
Th-That's not true at all!
You sure? If you say so.

(For some reason, Tohka's having difficulty
walking. I wonder if her feet hurt. But I think
she would've said something.)

(Well, I guess I'll just keep an eye out for
that.)
Oh, we're here.
OH! So many cute clothes.

(There was a section for winter attire, which
immediately caught Tohka's eye.)

Looks like they've got a seasonal section.
Why don't you pick out what you like?

Hm? Just one? Kotori said I can purchase
however much I want...

Oh, sorry. That's not what I meant. I'll buy
you one outfit myself. It's your first winter,
right? Let's ring it in in style.
Are you sure about that?
Of course. That's why we came here.

(It's a celebration. I can't afford designer
clothes, but I can do this much for her.)

(Kotori told me she would spot me if I didn't
have enough, but I denied it. It's pointless if
I can't buy it with my own money.)

(I have to look dependable. When I said that
to Kotori, she just laughed.)

But there are many shopgoers. I am unsure
if I can wear it and get your opinion.

Go ahead and choose what you want, Tohka.
You might find that you'll want to shop more
in the future, too. It's all good experience.
Got it! I shall pick out items for myself.
Hey, Shido? What's this?
Hm? Is that a scarf?
Scarf? What interesting fabric. How do I use it?

You wrap it around your shoulders, knees, or
body. It's pretty cozy.
Hm. Like this?
Right. You look great in it.

(After wrapping herself in the checkered
scarf, Tohka looked totally different.)

(She looked like a bookish librarian. Her long
hair was tucked neatly inside of the scarf, which
hugged her thin frame. Cute pattern, too.)

(If she were reading a book, sitting beside a
windowsill, it would be a lovely scene.)

...But Shido, this makes it difficult to eat.
I think I would get it dirty.
(Seems like she had other plans in mind.)

Well, you'd be wearing clothes underneath it,
so you could just remove it before you eat.
Oh, I see! That should be fine, then.

(Tohka appeared satisfied, and placed the scarf
back on the rack.)

There are too many clothes to choose from.
Shido, what catches your eye?

Um... Wait, no! Today, you're choosing for
yourself, right Tohka?
Y-Yes... That's true, but...
You can do it.
Okay, I'll try! Hm...? There are shoes, too.

(Tohka stopped at the back of the store.
Come to think of it, something was bothering
her earlier. Maybe her shoes don't match.)

Wanna try these out? Sit there. I'll grab you
a pair.
Then, can you get me those boots?
Sure. Leave it to me.
(Okay, these boots.)
Sorry for the wait.
Okay. Thanks Shido. Hold on.

(Tohka slipped her foot into the boots, but
she, not being used to the high top, was
having trouble.)
Hm. These are difficult to put on.
Yo... Mm... Like this...? No, that's wrong.
Sorry, Shido. Help me.
Okay. Hold on.

(I kneeled down in front of Tohka and took her
shoes off. I tried reaching for her foot, but...
I froze.)

(Obviously, Tohka had removed her shoes, and
now I could see her toes. Seeing them wrapped
in stockings was strangely captivating.)
Hm...? What's the matter, Shido?
Ugh... S-Sorry!
Huh...?
(I jumped, startled by her sudden question.)

(There's no way I could tell her that I was
mesmerized by her legs. I need to calm down.)
Are you okay, Shido? Are you ill after all?
No, I'm fine! It's nothing!

(I spat out a swift response and reached for her
foot.)
Mm...

(When I touched her, Tohka let out a small
grunt.)
Mm, Shido.. Aah...
Whoa...

(Tohka's legs are so smooth. I can feel her
warmth through her stockings...)
Mmm.

Sh-Shido, it's a bit strange to feel you touching
my legs...
Hey! Don't make this weird!
However strange it may be... I don't mind it.
(What is she saying?!)

(It almost feels like I'm doing something very
wrong.)

(I need to look away! If I don't look, it might
seem less suspicious...)
AH?!

(On the other hand, I'm kneeling right in front
of Tohka. Her knees are at my eye-level.)

(I can almost see the inside of her skirt
from between her knees. But I'm not looking!
I'm not...!)
Shido...?

(I froze, and Tohka looked down confusingly
at me. She blushed almost immediately.)
(Tohka clamped down her skirt.)
W-Were you looking, Shido...?
No! I didn't! I couldn't!
Really?
Really!
Really really?
Really really!
Then I believe you...
O-Okay.

(Uuunh... I feel terrible. Sorry, Tohka.
I promise to wipe the memory...)
How do they look, Shido? Are they ravishing?

Yeah, they are. Hey, why don't you grab that
scarf you pulled earlier, too?
Very well! I shall. How's this, Shido?
Perfect. They pair together nicely.

Then, Shido, is it okay for me to ask you if
can purchase it for me?

Sure thing. Are you sure? You can buy clothes
if you want.

Clothes can only be worn every so often,
but these accessories can be worn with any
outfit, understand?
...Got it.
I-Is that not okay...?

No. As long as you care for them, then I'm happy
to get them for you.
Okay!

(*sigh* That was an ordeal, but we did what
we came here to do. Except for buying clothes.)

Seeing the winter section was such a treat.
I thoroughly enjoyed myself. I want to wear
the shoes and scarf already!

(Tohka was giddy as she exited the shop.
It was a pleasure for both of us. I'd call it
a successful date.)

I'm sure it'll get colder, so it's good that we
got our shopping done ahead of time.
Yes! I cannot wait! Mm...
Whoa...

(Tohka was shivering. An icy gust just blew
through the air.)
(I wonder if Tohka's cold.)
Casually block the gust.
Stay put.
(I stepped in front of Tohka.)
Shido?

Oh. I was hoping to shield you from the wind
if at all possible.

(Tohka's hair blew back from the headwind.
The gust's intensity died down a bit, so maybe
my act was in vain.)
Shido, you are too kind.
Not really.

You don't think so? I mean, the wind slowed
down.

(Tohka flashed a grin, and suddenly another gust
of strong wind blew.)
Whoa!
Aaah!

(The wind messed up my balance, and I tipped
over.)
S-Sorry, Tohka!
AAAAAAH!
T-Tohka! I can see!
I thought you were blocking the wind!
Okay! I'll do it, so just hold down your skirt!
Urgh... Mm...
Aah!
Tohka! Your skirt flipped again!
NO! I told you not to look!
S-Sorry! Just hold it down!
Sh-Shido, you hold it down!
I can't do that!

(So we embraced, fighting against the frigid
chill and her lively skirt.)
Mm... It is getting rather cold.
Oh, sorry. I know, huh?

(Tohka saying it made me realized that she
still wasn't dressed in winter attire, so she
no doubt would be affected by the cold.)
(It would be for the best if we went indoors.)

If the wind picks up, I would not want to be
outside.

(Just as she muttered, a sudden gust of wind
blew.)
AAAAAH!
BU!
(What I saw almost made me choke.)

(Because I was a few steps behind Tohka, it
came into full view. Her skirt had lifted ever
so―)

WH-WH-WH-WH-WHAT ARE YOU LOOKING AT?!
YOU FOOL!
SSSSSSSSSSSORRY!
Yah!
Aah!
Whoa!
WHY?!
(Talk about timing!)

N-Not again, Shido! You had better not be
slithering behind me on purpose!
Of course not! Just hurry up and fix your skirt!

(And so, we were at the mercy of the blustery
wind.)
Sorry, Tohka.

(The wind slowed down, giving me time to
apologize.)

(Tohka was still pouty, but I couldn't blame
her. I'm sure it'd be annoying for the wind to
keep blowing up your skirt.)

Shido, you needn't apologize. I'm, um, sorry
too...
No. You did nothing wrong. I'm the one who saw.
That's not it.

You see, today... My skirt was shorter than
usual.
Huh? Really?

(I had a hunch it was shorter, and it was.
Glancing up and down at her, I noticed her
legs were more visible.)
D-Don't ogle me!
S-Sorry. I couldn't help it.

W-Were you worried about that? Is that why
you were walking funny?

I had felt as though... the smallest thing would
flip my skirt.
Isn't that to be expected with a shorter skirt?

I was told that, by doing so, you would be
happier...
Huh...?

Ai, Mai, and Mii said so. That wearing a shorter
skirt would be alluring.

(That's...disgraceful. Seriously... They...
Yeah, I guess I can thank them.)

They also had said that miniskirts are like
magnets to the eyes of men.
Shido, um... So were your eyes glued?

Well, glued or not, I guess I saw under...
Sorry.

(I was honest, but hoped it wouldn't embarrass
her. She could react any number of ways.)

No, it's okay. It means you were looking at me,
right Shido? I can take solace in that.
You're not mad?

Mad? Why, of course not. I did it with the
intention of showing you. If I were mad, it
would defeat the purpose.
But... I was a tad embarrassed.

Understandable. I'm glad then, Tohka. Thanks
for doing all of that for me.
Yeah!
(Tohka smiled meekly, then whispered...)
I am glad I mustered up the courage.
(Tohka gripped her skirt.)

B-But you can't stare too much! It is still
embarrassing!
O-Okay, got it.

(Yeah, uh. I guess skirts are best at a moderate
length, but short skirts are nice now and then.)
